before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"c4s7t","text":"Prior to oral gavage, ensure animals have been weighed and marked in some way so that you can identify individual animals. We weigh animals by placing them in a 1ml pipette tip box (with the insert removed) placed on a set of scales.  We use a marker pen to mark each animal's tail. For example, if there are 5 animals in a cage, we give each animal 1-5 lines across their tails.  In our experience, a black marker pen stays visible the longest.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7rvkm","text":"Citrobacter rodentium is a Gram-negative bacterium which infects laboratory mice in a similar way to how enteropathogenic Escherichia coli (EPEC) and enterohaemorrhagic E. coli (EHEC) infect humans. We routinely use a bioluminescent derivative of C. rodentium called ICC180 which allows us to monitor infection dynamics non-invasively using biophotonic imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":122,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":169,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":247,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sdi0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54dqp","text":"Experimental infection is typically initiated via oral gavage but we have previously shown that C. rodentium rapidly spreads between infected and uninfected animals and that bacteria shed from infected mice are 1000 times more infectious than laboratory-grown bacteria with a different tissue tropism.1,2 In this protocol, we describe the different methods for establishing an infection using natural transmission.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":96,"length":12},{"style":"sup","offset":301,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23mnm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bij1a","text":"1. Wiles, S., Dougan, G., \u0026 Frankel, G. (2005). Emergence of a 'hyperinfectious' bacterial state after passage of Citrobacter rodentium through the host gastrointestinal tract. Cellular microbiology, 7(8), 1163–1172. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1462-5822.2005.00544.x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":114,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs3db","text":"2. Bishop, A. L., Wiles, S., Dougan, G., \u0026 Frankel, G. (2007). Cell attachment properties and infectivity of host-adapted and environmentally adapted Citrobacter rodentium.Microbes and infection,9(11), 1316–1324. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.micinf.2007.06.006","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":172,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":195,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Infection of mice with Citrobacter rodentium ICC180 by oral gavage

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"akc4a","text":"Experiments involving animals and pathogenic bacteria require ethical and biological safety approval. When planning experiments involving animals, consult the PREPARE and ARRIVE guidelines.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":159,"length":7},{"key":1,"offset":171,"length":6}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8DCD5A90CCC211ECBADEE1860923E07B","url":"https://norecopa.no/prepare/prepare-checklist"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A5887CF0CCC211ECBADEE1860923E07B","url":"https://arriveguidelines.org/"}}}}
keywords: Citrobacter rodentium,oral gavage,mouse,mouse infection model,enteropathogen,in vivo,copraphagia,transmission,faecal-oral,fecal-oral,grooming,natural transmission, citrobacter rodentium through the host gastrointestinal tract, natural transmission citrobacter rodentium, icc180 by natural transmission citrobacter rodentium, citrobacter rodentium, infection of mice, infected mice, bacterial state after passage, shed from infected mice, enteropathogenic escherichia coli, experimental infection, laboratory mice, cellular microbiology, bacterial state, uninfected animal, bacteria, infection dynamic, infectious than laboratory, grown bacteria, host gastrointestinal tract, mice, negative bacterium, microbe, infectivity, infection, infectivity of host, using biophotonic imaging, biophotonic imaging, citrobacter rodentium icc180 by natural transmission citrobacter rodentium, citrobacter rodentium icc180
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"chahi","text":"Microorganism: Citrobacter rodentium ICC180","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":15,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mlnq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2oqfd","text":"Growth media and chemicals:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4er7o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csa1u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1lbfd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da80l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afthj","text":"Plasticware and equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a0t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbinb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fc41","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck427","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52rdd","text":"Animals and husbandry:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhkmi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"523o9","text":"6–7 week old C57BL/6Elite mice from specific-pathogen-free (SPF) stocks. We routinely work with female mice as male mice have a tendency to fight and this has an impact on infection dynamics, with stressed animals experiencing a more severe infection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4l66","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mia","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4c2ng","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9onar","text":"We house up to 6 animals in individually HEPA-filtered Tecniplast Blue line 1284L cages with sterile bedding materials (Grit-ology 1/8” corn cob and EnviroDri), a mouse house, and autoclaved cardboard tube for enrichment. We provide the animals with free access to sterile food (Teklad global 18% protein) and water. Conditions in the animal unit are controlled at 20-24°C, 45-65% relative humidity, and a 12-hour dark-light cycle. Lights turn on at 6:30 am and off at 6:30 pm with a 30 min dawn/dusk period starting at 6 am and 6 pm, respectively. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bljij","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Item","Catalogue number","Supplier"],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["LB (Lennox) Agar","240110","Fort Richard Laboratories"],["LB (Lennox) Broth","240230","Fort Richard Laboratories"],["Kanamycin","K4000","Sigma-Aldrich"],["Phosphate Buffered Saline tablets","P4417","Sigma-Aldrich"],["Isoflurane","","MedSource NZ Ltd."],["Glycerol","1040922511","Merck"]],"guid":"60582080CCC311ECBADEE1860923E07B","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["LB (Lennox) Agar","240110","Fort Richard Laboratories"],["LB (Lennox) Broth","240230","Fort Richard Laboratories"],["Kanamycin","K4000","Sigma-Aldrich"],["Phosphate Buffered Saline tablets","P4417","Sigma-Aldrich"],["Isoflurane","","MedSource NZ Ltd."],["Glycerol","1040922511","Merck"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Item","Catalogue Number","Supplier"],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Petridishes - 90mm x 14mm","S9001","medi'Ray NZ"],["  Falcon 50mL Conical Centrifuge Tube  ","  BDAA352070  ","  In vitro technologies  "],["1.7 mL microcentrifuge tube","AXYGMCT175C","Global Science"],["straight 4 cm Instech stainless steel feeding needle","","Harvard Apparatus"],["Pipette tips","",""],["Pipettes - mention.article_citation: Senghore, M., Read, H., Oza, P. et al. Inferring bacterial transmission dynamics using deep sequencing genomic surveillance data. Nat Commun 14, 6397 (2023). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-023-42211-8

parent_collections.title: Initiating and monitoring natural infection of mice by bioluminescent Citrobacter rodentium

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"21gra","text":"At least two days before needed, revive bacteria from frozen stocks stored at –70-80°C. Plate onto LB-Lennox media. At this stage, you can grow them with or without kanamycin   . Incubate     at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":175,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":189,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":195,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4emtb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"50","error_concentration":false,"guid":"C89D36A0CCC611ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1955}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"44BFA640CCAA11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"33D0EEC0CCAA11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmrjr","text":"The day before needed, inoculate   LB-Lennox (LB) media supplemented with kanamycin in a  tube. We generally inoculate using several colonies to provide a more heterogeneous culture for infection. Incubate    at   with shaking at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":89,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":206,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":212,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":230,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2mdgl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"6ED34950CCAA11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"90733A20CCAA11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"FC20FE10CCAA11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"01EB1420CCAB11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0DB7B560CCAB11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"200","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"datc6","text":"On the day of infection, centrifuge the culture at   for   and resuspend in   PBS to give a 10x concentrated inoculum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":57,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fau23","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"4500","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2272B720CCAB11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"5A812610CCAB11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"B2548440CCAB11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5sr1v","text":"To retrospectively calculate the number of bacteria in the inoculum, prepare a 10-fold dilution series of the inoculum in PBS and incubate 3   drops of each dilution onto LB plates (with or without kanamycin). Incubate overnight at   and count the colonies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":141,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":232,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4b03e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"F7610F90CCAB11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"785B3FD0CCAC11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c30t2","text":"[Optional] Animals can be lightly anaesthetised using gaseous isoflurane to aid gavage. To do this, place mice into the anaesthetic induction chamber and induce anaesthesia using a flow rate of 1 L/min oxygen combined with 5% isoflurane. Animals are sufficiently anaesthetised once the animals have lost their righting reflex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g2al","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehaia","text":"It is important that animals are not too deeply anaesthetised as their vital functions can be compromised. The respiratory rate of a normal undisturbed mouse is approximately 180 breaths per minute. A slow rate drop of 50% is acceptable during anaesthesia. Breathing should be steady. If the animals’ breathing becomes ‘‘jerky’’, too much anaesthetic is being applied and this will be fatal if maintained for long periods of time. If an animal appears too deeply anaesthetised, immediately turn off the anaesthetic and administer supplemental oxygen. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7eqd","text":"Using the feeding needle, orally gavage each animal with   of concentrated inoculum. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"927bo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j876","text":"This video is a good resource for people who are new to the technique: https://researchanimaltraining.com/articles/oral-gavage-in-the-mouse/. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":71,"length":69}],"data":{}},{"key":"83ad4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7lot","text":"To minimise the risk of oesophageal trauma and incorrect dosing, it is crucial that the operator is skilled both in the technique and the restraint method used. Inadvertent dosing into the lung may occur, and this usually results in the animal showing immediate signs of respiratory distress. If this is observed, then the animal should be humanely killed using an approved method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm7au","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"BD83E930CCAD11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"504BDEB5CCAE11ECA02B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://researchanimaltraining.com/articles/oral-gavage-in-the-mouse"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40jgr","text":"Transfer the inoculum to a   syringe and attach a feeding needle. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"779oo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"FA53B0C0CCAD11ECBADEE1860923E07B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24oc4","text":"After dosing, return animals to their cage and observe. If done correctly, the animals should resume normal activity within minutes.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"13g40","text":"Animals should be routinely monitored by measuring their weight, behaviour, and condition. The GRIMACE scale is ideal. The original study that developed the scale is online here and an explanatory poster and other resources are available here. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":173,"length":4},{"key":1,"offset":238,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"ai5lq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"508i4","text":"Depending on the size of the dose, some animals may not eat for a short period and so may experience some weight loss in the first 24 hours after gavage. If they are active and alert and their fur remains smooth and glossy, this is usually no cause for concern.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1A7CE240CCBD11ECBADEE1860923E07B","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nmeth.1455"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"00CD69F0CCBD11ECBADEE1860923E07B","url":"https://www.nc3rs.org.uk/3rs-resources/grimace-scales/grimace-scale-mouse"}}}}

steps.section: Natural transmission of C. rodentium from seed to naive mice
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fthqq","text":"At the peak of infection (usually between days 6-10 post-gavage) move one or more infected mice to a clean cage.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Natural transmission of C. rodentium from the environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1jgss","text":"[Optional] Instead of cohousing naive and infected mice together, infection can be initiated from a contaminated environment.  At the peak of infection (usually between days 6-10 post-gavage), transfer infected animals to a clean cage. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Natural transmission of C. rodentium from the environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2nhb6","text":"After 18-48 hours, remove infected animals from the cage and remove some stool from the cage into a preweighed microcentrifuge tube. This will enable you to retrospectively calculate the level of environmental C. rodentium contamination. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":210,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Natural transmission of C. rodentium from the environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aak24","text":"Add naive animals to the dirty cage. C. rodentium will transmit via coprophagia and generally occurs within 48 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":37,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Natural transmission of C. rodentium from seed to naive mice
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1jejk","text":"Add naive animals to the clean cage alongside the infected animals. C. rodentium will transmit via coprophagia and grooming. Transmission usually occurs within 48 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":68,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Natural transmission of C. rodentium from seed to naive mice
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ohm5","text":"All animals should be routinely monitored by measuring their weight, behaviour, and condition. The GRIMACE scale is ideal. The original study that developed the scale is online here and an explanatory poster and other resources are available here. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":177,"length":4},{"key":1,"offset":242,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"93EAA34ECFF511EC97200A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nmeth.1455"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"93EAA2A4CFF511EC97200A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nc3rs.org.uk/3rs-resources/grimace-scales/grimace-scale-mouse"}}}}

steps.section: Natural transmission of C. rodentium from the environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"10g51","text":"To retrospectively calculate the level of environmental C. rodentium contamination, add PBS to a final concentration of   of stool per    of PBS. Vortex briefly, then prepare a 10-fold dilution series in PBS and incubate 3   drops of each dilution onto LB plates supplemented with   kanamycin. Incubate overnight at   and count the colonies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":56,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":120,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":135,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":223,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":281,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":316,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"du8jt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.1","error":false,"guid":"0D84F20DCFF611EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"0D84F32ECFF611EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"F461BDF2CFF511EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"50","error_concentration":false,"guid":"5A7B3090CFF611ECAB9B39ABEDBC7C26","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1955}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F461BF30CFF511EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hrh6","text":"[Optional] To establish a defined transmission chain, co-house one infected mouse (usually around the peak of infection) and one naive mouse together in a clean cage. C. rodentium should transmit via coprophagia and grooming within 48 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":167,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fm3c4","text":"If transmission fails to occur,  re-established the transmission chain using an inoculum derived from the stool homogenate frozen in glycerol. Use a sample of the stool homogenate to inoculate    LB-Lennox (LB) media supplemented with kanamycin in a  tube. Incubate    at   with shaking at   and oral gavage as previously described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":194,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":250,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":266,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":272,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":290,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ekh37","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","duration":0,"error":false,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A796FE1ECFF811EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"shaker":"200","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","duration":0,"error":false,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A796FFAFCFF811EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"shaker":"200","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"A796F8DFCFF811EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A796FADACFF811EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A796FCB8CFF811EC97200A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"200","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4f9a1","text":"Around the peak of infection, collect stool samples from infected mice to monitor infection levels and reinitiate the transmission chain should natural transmission fail.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"203q1","text":"Label and weigh individual microfuge tubes. Write the weight on the side of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i95o","text":"Remove inserts from pipette tip boxes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26ffh","text":"Place the infected mouse in a clean pipette tip box. Once the mouse has produced 1-3 individual stools, transfer these to a sterile labelled microfuge tube of known weight using a pair of clean tweezers. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdr51","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55qmu","text":"Depending on the mouse strain, stools can become very loose and much more difficult to pick up using tweezers. In these instances, try using a small laboratory spatula instead. We've also observed mice placing their stools up on the walls of the tip box like they are moving them out of the way or making an offering.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e32ss","text":"Transfer the mouse back to its home cage and clean the pipette tip box.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7q71d","text":"Weigh the tube again to find the weight of the stool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3v2h","text":"Add PBS to a final concentration of    of stool per   of PBS. Homogenise using a vortex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":52,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bmkfq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.1","error":false,"guid":"8539E010DA0F11ECAA72DFDD0D6FDB0D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"8ED374B0DA0F11ECAA72DFDD0D6FDB0D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"47gjj","text":"To retrospectively determine the number of bacteria present, prepare a 10-fold dilution series in PBS and incubate 3   drops of each dilution onto LB plates supplemented with   kanamycin. Incubate overnight at   and count the colonies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":117,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":175,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":210,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","concentration":"50","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C4470B8DDA0F11EC90060A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"50","error_concentration":false,"guid":"C44709A7DA0F11EC90060A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1955}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","concentration":"50","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C4470AF2DA0F11EC90060A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flbfj","text":"To the remainder of the stool homogenate, add an equal volume of   glycerol to give a final concentration of   and store at   or below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":109,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":124,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6un5h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"50","error_concentration":false,"guid":"E97B9DC0DA0F11ECAA72DFDD0D6FDB0D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"25","error_concentration":false,"guid":"087F11C0DA1011ECAA72DFDD0D6FDB0D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"20885420DA1011ECAA72DFDD0D6FDB0D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-70","unit":10}}}}
